皱眉 [ zhòu méi ]: to frown; to knit one's brow

heisig_chinese_memo: The eyebrows hover over the eyes like a divided flag.
heisig_story: The flag here has an extra vertical stroke in it. Think of it as an eyebrow pencil stuck in the eye.
koohiiStory1: The eyebrows hover over the eyes like a divided flag.
koohiiStory2: Pictograph: opera glasses over eyes ビ ミ まゆ.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You're holding a flag on a stick above your eyes to imitate eyebrows. You can't grow any of your own, but you really love eyebrows, so this was the best you could do.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Look at yourself in the mirror. You can see the stick holding up the flag and it's very clear you drew some eyebrows onto the flag with some markers, but you still look pretty good (in your opinion).
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Underneath your fake eyebrows are two slabs of meat (み). Meat helps hair grow, according to many Internet specialists who also happen to sell meat. You're waiting for this meat to foster eyebrow hair, and when that sweet day comes you won't need these flags.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine walking around town, holding your eyebrow flags. You can feel the meat sticking above your eyes. They stink and they're weirdly lukewarm, but you know your real eyebrows will grow under them any day now.

Kanshudo_mnemonic: the stick (丨) corpse (尸) over the eye (目) is an eyebrow
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The eyebrows hover over the eyes like a divided flag.
humanum_full_description_en:
Jia Jin inscription from " eye " from ◎, ◎ like the shape of eyebrows, the original meaning is eyebrows. Inscriptions on the " head " add a long horizontal drawing for the eyebrows, and then add hair on the horizontal drawing to make the eyebrows more prominent. The ancients considered that drawing eyebrows alone is difficult to identify, so they draw eyes together.

The Jia Jin inscription is borrowed as " Mi " to indicate the end. "Collection" 27931: "𢆶(here) Yumei (Mi) Day", "Miri" means all day, meaning it rains all day. Guoshu Ding: "Use properly (sui) eyebrows (mi) 彔 (義)", "mei 彔" is pronounced "Mi Lu", which means full lu and full lu Bronze "彔" is the first version of " Lu ", which means blessing. "Complete (Sui)" means peace, which means being content with happiness. Jia Jinwen is also used as the name of the country.

The inscriptions on the inscriptions are also under the guise of " Mee ", which means the waterside, the minister [言逨] 簋: "Faihaimei (Mee)", "Haimei" is pronounced "Haimei", which means the seaside (Tanglan). "poetry. Qin Feng. "Jianjia": "Mee in the Water".

The bamboo slips of the Warring States period borrowed " moose " to express " eyebrow ", see " moose ".

"Shuowen": "Sui (eyebrow), the hair on the eye. From the eye, the shape is like the sui, and the upper is like the scorpion. All the genus of the sui is from the sui."
humanum_short_description_en: Inscription from " head " from ◎, ◎ like the shape of eyebrows, the original meaning is eyebrows.
humanum_full_description:
甲金文從「目」從◎，◎象眼睛上的眉毛之形，本義是眉毛。金文在「目」上加一長橫畫，是為眉，再於橫畫上加毛形，眉毛的意思更為突出。古人考慮到單獨畫出眉毛難以辨認，故連帶畫出眼睛。

　　甲金文假借為「彌」，表示終。《合集》27931：「𢆶(茲)雨眉(彌)日」，「彌日」即終日，表示整天下雨。國書鼎：「用妥(綏)眉(彌)彔(祿)」，「眉彔」讀作「彌祿」，意即滿祿、全祿。金文「彔」是「祿」的初文，表示福。「妥(綏)」是安的意思，表示安於完滿的福。甲金文又用作國名。

　　金文又假借為「湄」，表示水邊，小臣[言逨]簋：「伐海眉(湄)」，「海眉」讀作「海湄」，意指海邊(唐蘭)。《詩．秦風．蒹葭》：「在水之湄」。

　　戰國竹簡借「麋」來表示「眉」，參見「麋」。

　　《說文》：「睂(眉)，目上毛也。从目，象睂之形，上象頟理也。凡睂之屬皆从睂。」
humanum_short_description: 甲金文從「目」從◎，◎象眼睛上的眉毛之形，本義是眉毛。

眉(まゆ): eyebrow

甲金文從「 目 」從◎，◎象眼睛上的眉毛之形，本義是眉毛。金文在「 目 」上加一長橫畫，是為眉，再於橫畫上加毛形，眉毛的意思更為突出。古人考慮到單獨畫出眉毛難以辨認，故連帶畫出眼睛。 甲金文假借為「 彌 」，表示終。《合集》27931：「𢆶(茲)雨眉(彌)日」，「彌日」即終日，表示整天下雨。國書鼎：「用妥(綏)眉(彌)彔(祿)」，「眉彔」讀作「彌祿」，意即滿祿、全祿。金文「 彔 」是「 祿 」的初文，表示福。「妥(綏)」是安的意思，表示安於完滿的福。甲金文又用作國名。 金文又假借為「 湄 」，表示水邊，小臣[言逨]簋：「伐海眉(湄)」，「海眉」讀作「海湄」，意指海邊(唐蘭)。《詩．秦風．蒹葭》：「在水之湄」。 戰國竹簡借「 麋 」來表示「 眉 」，參見「 麋 」。 《說文》：「睂(眉)，目上毛也。从目，象睂之形，上象頟理也。凡睂之屬皆从睂。」
Jia Jin inscription from " eye" from ◎, ◎ like the shape of eyebrows, the original meaning is eyebrows. Inscriptions on the " head" add a long horizontal drawing for the eyebrows, and then add hair on the horizontal drawing to make the eyebrows more prominent. The ancients considered that drawing eyebrows alone is difficult to identify, so they draw eyes together. The Jia Jin inscription is borrowed as " Mi" to indicate the end. "Collection" 27931: "𢆶(here) Yumei (Mi) Day", "Miri" means all day, meaning it rains all day. Guoshu Ding: "Use properly (sui) eyebrows (mi) 彔 (義)", "mei 彔" is pronounced "Mi Lu", which means full lu and full lu Bronze " 彔" is the first version of " Lu", which means blessing. "Complete (Sui)" means peace, which means being content with happiness. Jia Jinwen is also used as the name of the country. The inscriptions on the inscriptions are also under the guise of " Mee", which means the waterside, the minister [言逨] 簋: "Faihaimei (Mee)", "Haimei" is pronounced "Haimei", which means the seaside (Tanglan). From the eye, the shape is like the sui, and the upper is like the scorpion. All the genus of the sui is from the sui."

眉
méi
眼上额下的毛：眉毛。眉宇（两眉上面的地方）。眉心。眉目。眉寿（长寿）。眉睫。扬眉吐气。

眉字的源字形
眉字的起名意思

：指眼上方的弓或嵴，亦指生长在这条嵴上的眉毛或指书页上端的空白，也借指美女。

eyebrow
Basic explanation of words
eyebrow
méi
Eyes and forehead: eyebrows. Eyebrow (the place above both eyebrows). Between the eyebrows. looks. Eyebrow longevity (longevity). imminent. Excited.
The blank at the top of the page: book header. Eyebrow batch.

eyebrow
Source glyph
eyebrow
Name meaning
: Refers to the bow or ridge above the eyes, also refers to the eyebrows growing on this ridge or the blank space at the top of the book page, and also refers to beautiful women.
méi
I сущ
1) брови
浓眉 густые брови
眉黑 тушь для бровей
2) притолока двери; рамка; верх; край; поля (наверху страницы);возле; около
井之眉 возле колодца
书眉 верхние поля книги
3) заголовок, название; надпись с названием (напр. над входом куда-л.)
4) старик; глубокий, почтенный (о возрасте)
眉寿 почтенный возраст
5)* вм. 湄 (пойменный берег реки)
II гл.
вм. 媚 (льстить; заигрывать)
III собств.
Мэй (фамилия)
Radicals: 尸, 目  (flag, eye, stick)
Meaning Mnemonic
You're holding a flag on a stick above your eyes to imitate eyebrows. You can't grow any of your own, but you really love eyebrows, so this was the best you could do.
Look at yourself in the mirror. You can see the stick holding up the flag and it's very clear you drew some eyebrows onto the flag with some markers, but you still look pretty good (in your opinion).
Reading Mnemonic
Underneath your fake eyebrows are two slabs of meat (み). Meat helps hair grow, according to many Internet specialists who also happen to sell meat. You're waiting for this meat to foster eyebrow hair, and when that sweet day comes you won't need these flags.
Imagine walking around town, holding your eyebrow flags. You can feel the meat sticking above your eyes. They stink and they're weirdly lukewarm, but you know your real eyebrows will grow under them any day now.
